fields.value: ABC News Republican Convention Quick Poll, August 1992

dsDescriptionValue.value: This poll, taken during the 1992 Republican National   Convention, provides a snapshot of voter sentiment regarding the 1992   presidential race. Respondents were asked to rate their chances of   voting in the election, to indicate for whom they would vote if the   election were held at the time of the interview and for whom they   would vote if Perot had stayed in the race, and to identify either   Bush or Clinton as the candidate who would do a better job of dealing   with the breakdown of family values and the economy. Background   information on respondents includes political alignment, voter  registration status, education, age, Hispanic origin, race, and sex.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

value: Adults aged 18 and over living in households with  telephones in the 48 contiguous United States.

fields.value: Households were selected by random digit dialing. Within   households, the respondent selected was the adult living in the   household who last had a birthday and who was home at the time of the  interview.
